title: Identify which layer added each header
text:
Headers are added by each layer in the Internet protocol stack to enable proper delivery and processing:

Application Layer – adds application-specific information (not typically in the link-layer frame).

Transport Layer – adds a segment header for process-to-process communication (e.g., TCP/UDP).

Network Layer – adds a datagram header for host-to-host addressing (e.g., IP).

Link Layer – adds a frame header for delivery across a single network link.

Physical Layer – does not add a header, it transmits raw bits.
